A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: Definitely had its flaws (Weak/poorly timed comedic one liners\, questionable pacing\, etc.)\, but the core message and critique of the force as a whole made this a much more interesting Star Wars movie for me. Dynamic characters are something that was sorely missing from much of the series for me. The Last Jedi helps to develop one-dimensional perspectives into something that I find to be much more satisfying.\n\nMy main anxiety going into this one was that they weren't going to develop any concepts enough to keep the story interesting. 7 was more of the same\, which I was okay with for the start of a new trilogy\, but I was worried 8 would carry on in that same vein. I now don't have that fear going into 9. (Assuming Abrams rolls with Johnson's storyline here)
